channel.title: AntiVirus Programs
channel.description: I was wondering if anyone knows any free antivirus programs or virus scanners that you don't need to register to use. There's this thing on my toolbar (next to the times) that is a red circe with an X in the middle...here's a pic: [img]http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/1936/virus3wy.png[/img] There's a few errors in there, like isn't anti-spyware supposed to be spelled like that? I think it's a virus, because it appears every minute or so, and when I click on it, nothing happened..

item.title: AntiVirus Programs
item.dc:creator: @arraness14 arraness14
item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

cmatuch:

[quote author=jme_009 link=topic=1065.msg10088#msg10088 date=1144299339]
Ah no no, you got something much more severe.

The proccess of deleting what you have is VERY DIFFICULT. I've been through it twice. No anti spyware will get rid of it, it creates hidden backups and re-downloads itself. There are many varients, you either have spy sherrif, spyaxe, smitfraud, cws, or something else.

This is what you need to follow, and quick. Your computer info is probably being sent to a brazillian black market.
(Btw, let me guess: you got it from browsing either a crack site, or a porn site, or a russian site?)

Here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spysheriff
You'll need to go into safe mode, run ewido anti mal-ware, smitfraud remover, and a bunch of other programs. And in normal mode you need to remove a lot of registry files and stuff, but go to that link, and it'll link you to good guides to get rid of it.

btw, thats not an actual message from windows, that message is fake by the program itself. Btw, ONLY browse the internet with firefox for now on, so they can;t download wmf files onto your computer from viewing a page.

I got it from a crack site, and I'm using firefox now. Way better than IE[br][size=1]Posted at: 06 April 2006, 09:02:31[/size][hr]I use the external links on wiki, right? They have virus scanners?[/quote]

Go in general section to the sticky on virus scanners. You will find ewido anti mal-ware and that is good for what you have but do int in safe mode. And If you now where it is hidden thenuse the program also in my thread called moveonboot.

link to thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,26.0/all.html

Read full topic
